results.content_en:
and
exceptions of Section I shall automatically apply to the optional plans
but not vice versa.
v.
Under no circumstances shall the optional plans be accepted again once
the previous optional plans have been terminated for whatever reason.
5. Policy Review Period
In case the Insured is not completely satisfied, the Insured is allowed to
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.cancel this Policy within the Policy Review Period, which is thirty (30) days
from the Effective Date of the Policy. Any Premium paid will be refunded to
you, provided that: (i) the Policy and the Certificate of Insurance, together
with a variation form signed by the Policyholder(s), are received by us within
the Policy Review Period and (ii) have not filed any claims under the Policy.
6. Payment of Premium
i. If the payment method selected is either via autopay or credit card, the
premium for this Policy shall be collected from the Insured's nominated
account in accordance with the collection date as stated in the Certificate
of Insurance. A second attempt will be made in the middle of the current
month should the previous collection fail due to insufficient funds.
ii.
If the payment mode is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card, the
Insured may request to change the nominated autopay bank account or
credit card account from which premium has been collected by completing
and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company.
Provided that the setup of the new nominated account is confirmed, the
Company will start the premium collection from the account on the next
collection date. Should the payment method be by autopay the Insured
must return the completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the
Company two (2) months before the use of the new payment method.
If the payment method is by credit card, the Insured must return the
completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company ten (10)
working days before the use of the new payment method. Change of
payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iii. If the payment mode is monthly by autopay or monthly by credit
card, the Insured may request to change the nominated autopay bank
account or credit card account from which premium has been collected
by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form to
the Company. Should the payment method be monthly by autopay the
Insured must return the Form together with a cheque for the premium
for the coming two (2) months. Provided that the setup of the new
nominated account is confirmed, the Company will resume monthly
premium collection on the third collection date from the date on which
such request is received. If the payment method is by credit card, the
Insured must return the completed Payment Details Amendment Form to
the Company ten (10) working days before the use of the new payment
method. Change of payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iv.
The Company shall have the right to change the collection date of
this Policy without prior notice, as well as have the right to revise and
determine the payment method of this Policy.
V.
Premium will be due for the full twelve (12) months' Period of Insurance
from the Effective Date regardless of yearly or monthly payment mode.
Eligible claims will be reimbursed only if the premium is paid up to date
at the time the claim is payable by the Company and the Insured is not
allowed to apply for mid-term cancellation during the Policy Year.
vi. No refund of premium shall be allowed once the Policy has been effected.
7.
Renewal and Variation
i.
The Company will notify the Insured of any alteration in relation to this
Policy that the Company deems to be material, but any accidental omission
or failure to notify the Insured shall not invalidate such alteration.
ii.
The Policy shall be effective for a period of one (1) year and shall be
guaranteed to be renewed annually (regardless of age of the Insured
Person) for Section I whilst the Policy shall be guaranteed to be renewed
annually for Section II the Optional Medical Plus Plan up to age 100
and for Section III the Optional Hospital Cash Plan shall be guaranteed
to be renewed annually up to age 74, subject to the Table of Benefits,
the Table of Premium, the Schedule of Surgical Operations, and the
Additions/ Amendments to this Policy that generally are in force at the
renewal date.
iii. The Company will renew this Policy automatically on a yearly basis upon
successful premium collection for such renewal, unless a designated
PRUChoice Medical-Variation Form for policy termination has been
received by the Company ten (10) days before the Effective Date of
the renewal.
iv.
If the payment mode is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card renewal,
the premium for the coming year shall be collected from the Insured's
nominated account automatically on the collection date as stated in
the renewal documents. If the payment mode is monthly by autopay or
monthly by credit card renewal, the premium will be collected monthly
from the Insured's nominated account automatically on the collection
date as stated in the renewal documents.
V.
Except for changing the nominated account from which premium has
been collected as mentioned in 5(ii) and (iii) above, the Insured may
apply for other variations by completing the Variation Form within one
(1) month before the Effective Date of renewal for the approval of the
Company.
vi. Acceptance of any higher level of cover shall not apply to any conditions
or complaints existing at the time of the Company's acceptance for which
there was then a foreseeable need for Treatment or for consultation
with any medical practitioner, unless such foreseeable need was fully
disclosed to the Company at the time of application and accepted by
the Company.
vii. The Company shall have the right to alter the Table of Benefits (including
the Table of Premium) and the terms and conditions of this Policy from
time to time. This Policy shall not be subject to any such alternations
until the next renewal of this Policy.
viii. The Company has the right to adjust premium rates on a community
pool basis because of several factors, including the Company's claims
and persistency experience.
8.
Termination
In case of non-payment of premium, the Company shall have the right to
terminate this Policy by sending a written termination notice to the Insured
at his/ her last known address; such termination of this Policy shall become
effective on the first date when premium is not received by the Company.
9.
Currency
i.
Both premium and claims of this Policy shall be made in Hong Kong
dollars.
ii.
Any claim under this Policy made by the Insured in a currency other
than Hong Kong dollars shall be converted to Hong Kong dollars at the
official buying rate of such currency for Hong Kong dollars in effect in
Hong Kong at the date of clinical visit or date of discharge from Hospital
or, if no such official rate exists, at the rate certified as appropriate by
bankers of the Company for the time being.
10. Claims
i.
Any medical report as reasonably required by the Company shall be
furnished at the expense of the Insured. The Company shall have the
right to medically examine any Insured Person in respect of the submitted
claim and shall also have the right to require an autopsy in case of the
death of any Insured Person where it is not forbidden by law.
ii.
Any claim payments made in any circumstances for which this Policy
does not provide shall in all cases be at the Company's sole discretion.
iii.
If any claim made shall be found to be fraudulent or exaggerated, the
Company shall have the right to terminate this Policy and the Insured
and the Insured Person shall repay to the Company all indemnity and
benefits paid by the Company in respect of such fraudulent or exaggerated
claims. The Company shall have the right to recover from the Insured
and the Insured Person any costs in relation to such termination and
such fraudulent or exaggerated claims.
iv.
Any claim payments will be made to the bank account as designated
by the Insured at the time of application of this policy, or by a cheque
payable to the Insured should the bank account not be designated at
the time of such application.
V.
The Insured must report to the Company in writing in case of the loss
of a daims cheque. A handling fee of HK$100 shall be charged for each
cheque reissuance.
vi.
No reimbursement of claims shall be made for claim(s) submitted after
ninety (90) days from the date of the expenditure being incurred or
insufficiency of required information.
11. Jurisdiction
The Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws
of Hong Kong. The parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of
Hong Kong courts.
12. Assignment
This Policy shall not be assignable and payment of any indemnity and benefits
by the Company under this Policy shall only be made to the Insured or his/
her legal personal representatives whose receipt of such indemnity and
benefits from the Company via cheque or by autopay through the Insured's
nominated bank account number for claim reimbursement, shall be a full
discharge of the Company's obligation towards the Insured and the Insured
Person in respect of such claim.
13. Arbitration
All differences, disputes or claims arising out of this Policy shall be referred
to the decision of an arbitrator to be appointed in writing by the parties in
difference or if they cannot agree upon a single arbitrator, to the decision
of two arbitrators one to be appointed by each of the parties in writing or,
in case the arbitrators do not agree with each other an umpire appointed
by the arbitrators in writing will make a decision. The making of the award
shall be a condition precedent to any liability of the Company or any right of
action against the Company in respect of any claim. The seat of arbitration
shall be in Hong Kong.
14. Third Party Right
A person or entity who is not a party to this Policy shall have no rights under
the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Ordinance (Cap. 623 of the Laws of
Hong Kong) to enforce any terms of this Policy.
15. Prevailing Provision
The terms and conditions of this Insurance are set out in both English and
Chinese. In the event that conflicts or inconsistence arise between the English
and Chinese versions, the English version shall prevail.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.
results.content_tc:
and
exceptions of Section I shall automatically apply to the optional plans
but not vice versa.
v.
Under no circumstances shall the optional plans be accepted again once
the previous optional plans have been terminated for whatever reason.
5. Policy Review Period
In case the Insured is not completely satisfied, the Insured is allowed to
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.cancel this Policy within the Policy Review Period, which is thirty (30) days
from the Effective Date of the Policy. Any Premium paid will be refunded to
you, provided that: (i) the Policy and the Certificate of Insurance, together
with a variation form signed by the Policyholder(s), are received by us within
the Policy Review Period and (ii) have not filed any claims under the Policy.
6. Payment of Premium
i. If the payment method selected is either via autopay or credit card, the
premium for this Policy shall be collected from the Insured's nominated
account in accordance with the collection date as stated in the Certificate
of Insurance. A second attempt will be made in the middle of the current
month should the previous collection fail due to insufficient funds.
ii.
If the payment mode is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card, the
Insured may request to change the nominated autopay bank account or
credit card account from which premium has been collected by completing
and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company.
Provided that the setup of the new nominated account is confirmed, the
Company will start the premium collection from the account on the next
collection date. Should the payment method be by autopay the Insured
must return the completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the
Company two (2) months before the use of the new payment method.
If the payment method is by credit card, the Insured must return the
completed Payment Details Amendment Form to the Company ten (10)
working days before the use of the new payment method. Change of
payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iii. If the payment mode is monthly by autopay or monthly by credit
card, the Insured may request to change the nominated autopay bank
account or credit card account from which premium has been collected
by completing and returning a Payment Details Amendment Form to
the Company. Should the payment method be monthly by autopay the
Insured must return the Form together with a cheque for the premium
for the coming two (2) months. Provided that the setup of the new
nominated account is confirmed, the Company will resume monthly
premium collection on the third collection date from the date on which
such request is received. If the payment method is by credit card, the
Insured must return the completed Payment Details Amendment Form to
the Company ten (10) working days before the use of the new payment
method. Change of payment mode is not allowed during the Policy Year.
iv.
The Company shall have the right to change the collection date of
this Policy without prior notice, as well as have the right to revise and
determine the payment method of this Policy.
V.
Premium will be due for the full twelve (12) months' Period of Insurance
from the Effective Date regardless of yearly or monthly payment mode.
Eligible claims will be reimbursed only if the premium is paid up to date
at the time the claim is payable by the Company and the Insured is not
allowed to apply for mid-term cancellation during the Policy Year.
vi. No refund of premium shall be allowed once the Policy has been effected.
7.
Renewal and Variation
i.
The Company will notify the Insured of any alteration in relation to this
Policy that the Company deems to be material, but any accidental omission
or failure to notify the Insured shall not invalidate such alteration.
ii.
The Policy shall be effective for a period of one (1) year and shall be
guaranteed to be renewed annually (regardless of age of the Insured
Person) for Section I whilst the Policy shall be guaranteed to be renewed
annually for Section II the Optional Medical Plus Plan up to age 100
and for Section III the Optional Hospital Cash Plan shall be guaranteed
to be renewed annually up to age 74, subject to the Table of Benefits,
the Table of Premium, the Schedule of Surgical Operations, and the
Additions/ Amendments to this Policy that generally are in force at the
renewal date.
iii. The Company will renew this Policy automatically on a yearly basis upon
successful premium collection for such renewal, unless a designated
PRUChoice Medical-Variation Form for policy termination has been
received by the Company ten (10) days before the Effective Date of
the renewal.
iv.
If the payment mode is yearly by autopay or yearly by credit card renewal,
the premium for the coming year shall be collected from the Insured's
nominated account automatically on the collection date as stated in
the renewal documents. If the payment mode is monthly by autopay or
monthly by credit card renewal, the premium will be collected monthly
from the Insured's nominated account automatically on the collection
date as stated in the renewal documents.
V.
Except for changing the nominated account from which premium has
been collected as mentioned in 5(ii) and (iii) above, the Insured may
apply for other variations by completing the Variation Form within one
(1) month before the Effective Date of renewal for the approval of the
Company.
vi. Acceptance of any higher level of cover shall not apply to any conditions
or complaints existing at the time of the Company's acceptance for which
there was then a foreseeable need for Treatment or for consultation
with any medical practitioner, unless such foreseeable need was fully
disclosed to the Company at the time of application and accepted by
the Company.
vii. The Company shall have the right to alter the Table of Benefits (including
the Table of Premium) and the terms and conditions of this Policy from
time to time. This Policy shall not be subject to any such alternations
until the next renewal of this Policy.
viii. The Company has the right to adjust premium rates on a community
pool basis because of several factors, including the Company's claims
and persistency experience.
8.
Termination
In case of non-payment of premium, the Company shall have the right to
terminate this Policy by sending a written termination notice to the Insured
at his/ her last known address; such termination of this Policy shall become
effective on the first date when premium is not received by the Company.
9.
Currency
i.
Both premium and claims of this Policy shall be made in Hong Kong
dollars.
ii.
Any claim under this Policy made by the Insured in a currency other
than Hong Kong dollars shall be converted to Hong Kong dollars at the
official buying rate of such currency for Hong Kong dollars in effect in
Hong Kong at the date of clinical visit or date of discharge from Hospital
or, if no such official rate exists, at the rate certified as appropriate by
bankers of the Company for the time being.
10. Claims
i.
Any medical report as reasonably required by the Company shall be
furnished at the expense of the Insured. The Company shall have the
right to medically examine any Insured Person in respect of the submitted
claim and shall also have the right to require an autopsy in case of the
death of any Insured Person where it is not forbidden by law.
ii.
Any claim payments made in any circumstances for which this Policy
does not provide shall in all cases be at the Company's sole discretion.
iii.
If any claim made shall be found to be fraudulent or exaggerated, the
Company shall have the right to terminate this Policy and the Insured
and the Insured Person shall repay to the Company all indemnity and
benefits paid by the Company in respect of such fraudulent or exaggerated
claims. The Company shall have the right to recover from the Insured
and the Insured Person any costs in relation to such termination and
such fraudulent or exaggerated claims.
iv.
Any claim payments will be made to the bank account as designated
by the Insured at the time of application of this policy, or by a cheque
payable to the Insured should the bank account not be designated at
the time of such application.
V.
The Insured must report to the Company in writing in case of the loss
of a daims cheque. A handling fee of HK$100 shall be charged for each
cheque reissuance.
vi.
No reimbursement of claims shall be made for claim(s) submitted after
ninety (90) days from the date of the expenditure being incurred or
insufficiency of required information.
11. Jurisdiction
The Policy shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws
of Hong Kong. The parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of
Hong Kong courts.
12. Assignment
This Policy shall not be assignable and payment of any indemnity and benefits
by the Company under this Policy shall only be made to the Insured or his/
her legal personal representatives whose receipt of such indemnity and
benefits from the Company via cheque or by autopay through the Insured's
nominated bank account number for claim reimbursement, shall be a full
discharge of the Company's obligation towards the Insured and the Insured
Person in respect of such claim.
13. Arbitration
All differences, disputes or claims arising out of this Policy shall be referred
to the decision of an arbitrator to be appointed in writing by the parties in
difference or if they cannot agree upon a single arbitrator, to the decision
of two arbitrators one to be appointed by each of the parties in writing or,
in case the arbitrators do not agree with each other an umpire appointed
by the arbitrators in writing will make a decision. The making of the award
shall be a condition precedent to any liability of the Company or any right of
action against the Company in respect of any claim. The seat of arbitration
shall be in Hong Kong.
14. Third Party Right
A person or entity who is not a party to this Policy shall have no rights under
the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Ordinance (Cap. 623 of the Laws of
Hong Kong) to enforce any terms of this Policy.
15. Prevailing Provision
The terms and conditions of this Insurance are set out in both English and
Chinese. In the event that conflicts or inconsistence arise between the English
and Chinese versions, the English version shall prevail.
IMPORTANT - the Insured Person is requested to read this Policy. If any error or omission be found, the Policy should be returned to the Company for correction.

Please be reminded to retain the following documents for claims application:
$
1. Reason(s) for cancellation/curtailment with all relevant supporting documents (Please see
the following examples)
·
Letter from treating doctor indicating the diagnosis and reasons that the insured
person is bodily unfit for travel.
·
Death certificate.
.
Relationship proof if the cancellation/curtailment is due to death, serious bodily injury
or illness of the immediate family member.2. ORIGINAL booking invoices and ORIGINAL confirmation from relevant authorities
regarding the refundable amount for any prepaid costs or deposits made.
* 'First issuance' means the alert first issued in respect of a specific event or incident ever since the Outbound Travel
Alert system existed
Re-Routing & Travel Delay
HOW WILL
WE GET
TO WORK !
ON STRIKE
HOSTAGES
ARE
REBELLING
If your aircraft, train or sea vessel is being delayed due to strike or industrial
actions, hi-jack, terrorist attack, adverse weather, natural disaster (including
earthquake, tsunami and volcanic eruption), mechanical or structural defect or
closure of airport, port or train station, we will pay you travel delay cash benefit if
such delay is more than 5 hours, or we will reimburse you the re-routing expenses
if such delay is more than 8 hours. Please retain the following documents for
claims application:
V ORIGINAL confirmation from the airline, train or ship company regarding the
total number of hours and the reason for the delay.
V ORIGINAL documentary proof for the original itinerary e.g. boarding pass and
air-ticket.
V For re-routing claim - ORIGINAL receipts showing any prepaid costs or
deposits made OR additional accommodation and transportation expenses
incurred as a result of re-routing.
Delayed Baggage
In the event of delayed checked-in baggage for more than 8 hours from time of arrival at
destination abroad due to mishandling by the airlines or hi-jack, we will pay for the
compensation for purchasing essential items. Please retain the following documents for
the claims application:
ORIGINAL confirmation from the airline that the baggage was delayed abroad for
more than 8 hours with reason(s).
V
ORIGINAL purchase receipts for emergency purchase of essential items.
The claims application after arriving in Hong Kong
1.
How to get your claim processed smoothly?
i. Fill in and sign the Travel Insurance claim form and submit to us with all supporting documents ..
ii. For Single Trip, submit to us within 31 days from the expiry of the Policy.
iii. For Annual Cover, submit to us not later than 31 days from the date of return to Hong Kong.
2. This Travel Claim Tips is a general guideline. We may request for additional information depending on individual
claim case. Should you have any queries, we suggest you to contact us or your insurance consultant directly. For
more information on the terms and conditions of PRUchoice Travel, please refer to the Policy Provision.
